CNN used to do The News very well. They rotated and repeated the headlines every 30min on a loop so you could tune in quickly and get updates including national weather. They would update the stories as new stories emerged or more information was obtained.

That changed when they and other networks started having segments or opinion shows that gave variety. That eventually led to more viewers and advert revenue so the opinion eventually became the news. With phones and internet access so readily available, this would be a difficult method to return to.

It shouldn't matter how the CEO of any company thinks or 'leans'. A commercial venture is, or should be, built around profit. Profit rotates money out of and back into a community/society. You can cater to a certain demographic, but if the business isn't profitable, it's all for not. It then turns into a nonprofit mission that has to be subsidized from somewhere else.
Once a commercial venture is profitable, if they want to channel any amount of those profits into an outside cause, that's up to them. But a company like CNN running in the red indefinitely is simply unsustainable, unless it is turned into a nonprofit organization that is funded from the outside. Then it is no longer a commercial venture.
